intro: Palicourea ayangannensis, commonly known as Ayanganna's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
